abstract.p: Scene at New York Rangers' training camp in Burlington, Vt, described (S)

block.p: Soreness set in ever so subtly at the Rangers' camp in Burlington, Vt., yesterday as Mark Messier and Radek Dvorak removed themselves from a scrimmage because of stiffness.

''It's nothing,'' said Messier, who has a sore left groin, and who described his removal as precautionary. ''It's a little bit stiff. So instead of trying to push through, I decided to take a half-day off so I will be fine. When you push through, that's when you pull something. It's just typical training camp soreness.''
Soreness set in ever so subtly at the Rangers' camp in Burlington, Vt., yesterday as Mark Messier and Radek Dvorak removed themselves from a scrimmage because of stiffness.

''It's nothing,'' said Messier, who has a sore left groin, and who described his removal as precautionary. ''It's a little bit stiff. So instead of trying to push through, I decided to take a half-day off so I will be fine. When you push through, that's when you pull something. It's just typical training camp soreness.''
Dvorak, who complained of a stiff back, said, ''It's just a little tight; it's no big deal.''
The Rangers will have their annual blue-white scrimmage tonight.
''We're pretty committed that we're going to play the best 40 players we have,'' Coach Ron Low said. ''But it's questionable whether Mark or Dvorak will play.''
